critterModels

Class Critter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • critterModels.Critter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BossCritter, LargeCritter, MediumCritter, RegularCritter

    public abstract class Critter
extends java.util.Observable

    The Critters SuperClass

    This class is the Critters superclass implementing all the general methods found in each critter subclass. This simplifies the code style and takes advantage of information expert and polymorphism.

    Each critter has a certain amount of health and moves at a certain speed along the map. Based on our game's Business Rules there are only going to be four types of critters: Regular, Medium, Large, and Boss.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Justin Asfour

    • Method Detail

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        This method keeps track of whether the critter is dead or not
        Returns:
        true if critter's health goes to 0, indicating that the critter is dead gives the player a reward based on the killed critter.

      • damage

        public void damage(Player p)
        This method checks if the critter has reached the exit and then reduces the player's health appropriately.
        Parameters:
        p - of Player class

      • damageCritter

        public void damageCritter(int amountOfDamageTaken,
                 boolean negativePowerEffect,
                 boolean negativeSpeedEffect)
        This method is used to damage Critter by taking in 3 parameters the tower's attack, and which negative effect will hurt it. The effect is a boolean which is changed in the game controller for a certain time.
        Parameters:
        amountOfDamageTaken - : The damage that is taken from the tower
        negativePowerEffect - : The boolean value that will define a change in the critter's power
        negativeSpeedEffect - : The boolean value that will define a slowdown in the critter's movement

      • hasReachedExit

        public boolean hasReachedExit()
        Indicates whether the Critter has made it to the exit
        Returns:
        true if reached exit cell else false

      • setMovement

        public void startWalking()
